resources:
Rasmussen Open navigation drawer Close navigation drawer Android Studio android.studio@android.com Navigation header Info
Introduction & Layouts Activities & Resources Intents & Fragments User Experience RecyclerViews Application Architecture Local Data Storage Networking Google Services Testing & Publishing Home Lectures Hello and welcome to the AND1 Exam Application called the Rasmussen.0 Please select a lecture from the Navigation drawer to get started. And here's a pokemon that you like. In the first lecture we learned about Layouts, Views, and basic components. For example: here is a button Here is a TextView inside of a FrameLayout Below is a LinearLayout with two ImageViews that have a set weight of 1 and 2. This is a constraint layout I do not like them that much, so i rarely use them. And those were the main things we learnt in the first lesson. In the Second Lecture we learnt a lot of theory about stuff like activities, linking XML with code, resources, localization, icons, styles, themes and etc. 
 
 This is a button that shows a Toast, and sets its name to the text provided in the EditText field. It also writes a Log message. Button Enter desired button text Here is a progress bar you can play around with + - By clicking the button below, you can change the style of this text and the icon of the button And this lecture reacts to orientation changes. 

 That is it for the second lecture.
